intro: Marrubium thessalum, commonly known as Greek horehound, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and clusters of small blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It is valued for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating respiratory and digestive ailments. Marrubium thessalum is also noted for its aromatic scent and is sometimes used in herbal teas and traditional remedies.
